description: After an exciting open to the men’s bracket of the NCAA Tournament on Thursday, the second round begins Saturday with some tantalizing matchups.
title: NCAA Tournament: What to watch in Saturday's slate of March Madness games

description: McNeese’s upset win over Clemson in the first round of the NCAA men’s basketball tournament was a big deal for the team and yet the players on the court are being upstaged by their student manager on the sidelines. NBC News’ Sam Brock catches up with Amir Khan who has gone viral in part because of his tunnel, boombox walk-outs in which he is rapping along with the team.
title: Student Manager steals spotlight during first round of March Madness

description: It's unclear what's next for Kaitlyn Conley, the woman accused of poisoning her ex-boyfriend's mother and boss Mary Yoder, after two murder trials and a conviction.
title: After two murder trials and a conviction, future of woman accused of poisoning her boss is uncertain

description: Welcome to the online version of From the Politics Desk, an evening newsletter that brings you the NBC News Politics team’s latest reporting and analysis from the White House, Capitol Hill and the campaign trail.
title: Trump's legal fights and Elon Musk's business overlap: From the Politics Desk

description: The measles outbreak that began in Texas before spreading to at least two other states swelled to 355 confirmed cases on Friday — and officials say there is no sign it’s slowing.
title: 'I'm worried it's getting worse': Texas measles outbreak grows as families resist vaccination

description: Since his deportation on Feb. 6, former South Florida teacher and asylum seeker Wualner Sauceda now lives with relatives in Honduras in a remote, rural area with dirt roads and no running water.
title: South Florida school teacher was applying for asylum when he was deported to Honduras

description: As the public face of President Donald Trump’s Department of Government Efficiency, billionaire tech CEO Elon Musk has an expansive portfolio that spans across the many levers of government — and that could intersect with his wide range of business interests.
title: How the White House is handling Elon Musk and potential conflicts of interest

description: Several federal judges expressed frustration this week with how President Donald Trump’s administration is pushing forward his sweeping agenda, as Trump and his allies got even more aggressive in their criticism of the judiciary.
title: Judges stand firm as Trump ramps up attacks on judiciary

description: President Donald Trump said Friday that the Small Business Administration, instead of the U.S.
title: Trump says student loans will be handled by Small Business Administration

description: Elon Musk's visit to the Pentagon is raising concerns about a potential conflict of interest since the tech mogul has business ties to both the Department of Defense and China. NBC News' Courtney Kube reports on the topics discussed during his visit.
title: Pentagon denies China was discussed in briefing with Elon Musk

description: Law enforcement and extremism experts find no evidence of coordinated attacks on Teslas, despite claims from CEO Elon Musk and President Donald Trump.
title: No evidence of coordinated vandalism of Teslas despite Musk and Trump claims

description: The Defense Department released new guidance on how it will enforce President Trump’s ban on transgender people in the military, and asked a federal judge to lift her recent order blocking the ban.
title: Pentagon releases guidance on trans military ban, seeks to lift court order

description: Nike’s Jumpman, roses and a popular phrase from a Donald Trump-supporting Puerto Rican rapper: These are some of the tattoos defense lawyers and relatives say helped authorities accuse several Venezuelan men of belonging to Tren de Aragua gang.
title: Tattoos of deported Venezuelans don't necessarily signal gang affiliation, experts say

description: The No. 2 Alabama Crimson Tide survived an upset bid by No. 15 Robert Morris on Friday, winning 90-81 after a close game.
title: No. 2 Alabama survives scare from No. 15 Robert Morris in first round of NCAA Tournament

description: A white West Virginia couple found guilty of forcing their five adopted Black children to work as "slaves" on their farm were sentenced to hundreds of years in prison.
title: Couple sentenced to hundreds of years in prison for forcing adopted Black children to work as ‘slaves’

description: One of two ICE detainees, who fled after a Colorado jail’s electrical power gave out and inadvertently opened doors to freedom, was captured on Friday, authorities said.
title: ICE detainee, who fled during power outage at Colorado jail, back in custody

description: Yeshiva University in New York has agreed to recognize an LGBTQ student club after years of legal disputes that at one point reached the U.S. Supreme Court.
title: Yeshiva University will recognize LGBTQ student club after years of dispute

description: Alpha-gal syndrome, a red meat allergy caused by a bite from the lone star tick, may also be triggered by the deer tick and the western black-legged tick.
title: A meat allergy caused by ticks may be popping up in new parts of the U.S.

description: The General Services Administration is launching a new artificial intelligence tool for government use, designed to support staff at the agency in their regular, daily work, with the goal of rolling it out to other federal agencies in the near future.
title: Trump administration launching an AI tool for government use

description: Rapper Eminem said "significant damage was caused" and his team is "appreciative" after his former longtime employee was charged with leaking his unreleased music online.
title: Former Eminem employee charged with leaking unreleased music

description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service issued a recall of approximately 29,541 pounds of ready-to-eat beef stick brand Chomps on Wednesday after discovering metal in the product.
title: USDA recalls nearly 30,000 pounds of Chomps Beef Sticks after discovering metal

description: Passengers affected by the power outage that shut down London's Heathrow Airport Friday are not automatically entitled to compensation for their flight disruption, experts say.
title: How passengers affected by the Heathrow outage can get reimbursed

description: Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee said Friday he still sees interest rate cuts in the cards though risks are rising to that outlook.
title: Chicago Fed's Austan Goolsbee sees rate cuts depending on inflation progress

description: Flights have resumed at London's Heathrow airport after an overnight fire and power outage forced the airport to shut down operations. NBC News' Daniele Hamamdjian reports on the latest developments and the passengers left stranded worldwide.
title: Flights resume at Heathrow airport after electrical fire and power outage

description: A six-figure household income doesn’t necessarily make you rich — in many cases, it just means you’re middle class. The upper bound of what’s considered middle class for households exceeds $100,000 in every U.S. state, according to a SmartAsset analysis of 2023 income data, the most recent available from the U.S.
title: The salary you need to be considered middle class in every U.S. state

description: Bella Ramsey, star of the HBO drama “The Last of Us,” revealed their autism diagnosis following filming of season one in an interview with British Vogue on Wednesday.
title: Bella Ramsey shares autism diagnosis following season one of 'The Last of Us'

description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Thursday walked back comments he made in January, when he cast doubt on whether useful quantum computers would hit the market in the next 15 years.
title: Nvidia CEO Huang says he was wrong about timeline for quantum, surprised his comments hurt stocks

description: Lyft is about to enter the increasingly competitive world of robotaxis.
title: Lyft to roll out robotaxis in Atlanta

description: A family of three is missing after leaving the Grand Canyon and driving through a winter storm earlier this month, Arizona authorities said on Wednesday.
title: Family of three missing after leaving Grand Canyon vacation, authorities say

description: No. 3 seed Texas Tech attempted an NCAA Tournament-record 46 3-pointers in an 82-72 victory over No. 14 seed UNC Wilmington on Thursday night.
title: No. 3 Texas Tech takes NCAA Tournament-record 46 3-pointers, advances past No. 14 UNC Wilmington

description: President Trump announced that the Small Business Administration would take over the handling of student loans after he signed an executive order aimed at dismantling the Department of Education.
title: Trump announces the Small Business Administration will handle student loans

description: As Elon Musk wraps up his second month in the White House, Tesla owners are trading in their electric vehicles at record levels, according to an analysis by national car shopping site Edmunds.
title: Tesla owners are trading in their EVs at record levels, Edmunds says

description: Building contractors are already hiking prices as much as 20% to offset potential tariffs, a move that could also raise prices of new condos and homes, according to the CEO of developer Related Group.
title: Tariff fears are raising construction costs by up to 20%, says Related Group CEO

description: The LA wildfires displaced thousands of residents. This father-daughter duo is providing them with free mobile homes and a little stability.
title: The father and daughter duo giving free RVs to wildfire survivors

description: Jenna Bainbridge will be the first wheelchair user to portray Nessarose in the 21-year history of 'Wicked' on Broadway.
title: This 'Wicked' Broadway actor is making history for performers with disabilities

description: With the women's NCAA Tournament now underway, which players should you focus on? It starts with Paige Bueckers and JuJu Watkins.
title: Paige Bueckers, JuJu Watkins headline players to watch in women's NCAA Tournament

description: Morrison, sometimes considered the "granddaddy of true crime," sat down with NBCU Academy to offer tips on making your voice an instrument of storytelling.
title: How Keith Morrison perfects his 'Dateline' voice

description: Barbershop Books is bringing hundreds of free books to Black barbershops across the country to help more boys become better readers.
title: The Black barbershops are helping boys fall in love with reading

description: A California prosecutor is attempting an unprecedented endeavor: ensure every death row case in his jurisdiction is resentenced to life in prison without parole.
title: California DA seeks rare change of mass shooter's death sentence to life without parole

description: The Cope Dealer and Hip-Hop Therapy Studio programs are helping teens take control of their mental health by turning their pain into art.
title: How teens are healing through hip-hop therapy

description: For decades, undocumented immigrants have lived in the U.S. territory without fear of arrest.  Then, on Jan. 26, large-scale arrests began.
title: ICE raids shatter perception of Puerto Rico as a sanctuary for immigrants

description: A one-of-a-kind Paul Skenes baseball card has been sold for $1.11 million after a two-week auction.
title: A one-of-a-kind Paul Skenes baseball card sells for $1.11 million via auction

description: The family of U.S. federal agent Enrique “Kiki” Camarena has filed a lawsuit against the Sinaloa cartel in Mexico and three suspected drug kingpins over his brutal kidnap and murder in 1985.
title: Family of slain U.S. DEA agent sues cartel and 3 suspected drug kingpins over 1985 murder

description: The Democrats running in a pair of April 1 special elections for deeply Republican House districts in Florida have raised a whopping $15.7 million combined in two months, but they still face steep uphill climbs in the upcoming campaigns.
title: Democrats raise millions for Florida special elections in Trump territory

description: The family of a Boeing whistle blower who had raised alarm over the company’s safety flaws and later died by a self-inflicted gunshot wound has filed a lawsuit against the company alleging wrongful death.
title: Family of Boeing whistle blower sues company alleging harassment campaign led to suicide

description: "Severance", the Apple TV+ series about the dystopian Lumon corporation, ended its season finale Thursday with another major cliffhanger.
title: 'Severance' season 2 finale leaves 'outies' with another cliffhanger — and season 3 is on the way

description: Kat Graham stars as a high-powered attorney who finds herself entangled in a deeply personal case in Tyler Perry’s new film, “Duplicity,” out on Prime Video.
title: Kat Graham's racial justice work comes through in new Tyler Perry film 'Duplicity'

description: Who was the father: Her fiancé, or the man with whom she had a brief fling?
title: She had an abortion after a botched paternity test. Now she's suing the DNA company.

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth deliver remarks at the White House.
title: Trump delivers remarks with Defense Secy. Hegseth

description: London’s Heathrow Airport will remain closed for the rest of the day Friday after a massive fire at an electricity substation caused a power outage at the major transportation center. More than a thousand of flights around the world are expected to be canceled or disrupted. NBC’s Raf Sanchez reports for TODAY.
title: Massive fire, power outage shuts down London's Heathrow Airport

description: Tech billionaire and Trump adviser Elon Musk is scheduled to visit the Pentagon on Friday for a briefing that will include a discussion on China, according to three defense officials.
title: Elon Musk to visit the Pentagon to discuss China

description: A federal judge in Los Angeles has ruled that Mariah Carey did not steal her perennial megahit “All I Want for Christmas Is You” from other songwriters.
title: Mariah Carey didn't steal 'All I Want For Christmas Is You' from other writers, judge says

description: Elon Musk to discuss China at Pentagon
title: Trump and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth give Oval Office remarks

description: Federal workers's rehiring confusion.
title: Travel chaos as Heathrow shuts and rehired federal workers in limbo: Morning Rundown

description: Lava from Hawaii’s most active volcano created fountains that reached 700 feet (215 meters) Thursday during the latest episode of an ongoing eruption.
title: Hawaii’s Kilauea volcano puts on dazzling show with lava fountains hundreds of feet high

description: Raphael Garcia is one of 24,000 probationary federal workers on a career roller-coaster ride as Elon Musk’s DOGE attempts to reshape the government.
title: Fired, rehired and baffled: Confusion reigns for thousands of reinstated federal workers

description: MATTESON, Ill. — This is what bird flu looks like.
title: How bird flu has devastated one American farm

description: Former President Joe Biden has told some Democratic leaders he’ll raise funds, campaign and do anything else necessary for Democrats to recover lost ground.
title: The Bidens want back in

description: Former Vice President Kamala Harris’ loss in the presidential race has given rise, again, to whispered worries in the Democratic Party about female candidates and electability — resurrecting a fraught conversation that bubbled for years after President Donald Trump’s first victory over Hillary Clinton.
title: Trump's second win has some questioning women's electability. Mikie Sherrill says 'Watch me.'

description: Before 2025, there were only six women's sports bars across the U.S. By the end of this year, the number is expected to be about two dozen, according to an NBC News analysis.
title: Women's sports bars expected to quadruple across the U.S. in 2025

description: Sudan’s military said Friday that it had retaken the Republican Palace in Khartoum, the last heavily guarded bastion of rival paramilitary forces in the capital, after nearly two years of fighting.
title: Sudan’s military says it has retaken seat of country’s government for the first time in two years

description: North Korea said it had test-launched new anti-aircraft missiles, as its military threatened unspecified grave steps against the U.S. and South Korea over their joint military drills.
title: North Korea says it tested new missiles as it threatens strong steps against U.S.-South Korea drills

description: London's Heathrow Airport closed Friday local time and will remain closed all day after a fire at a nearby electricity substation caused power outages at the major transportation center.
title: London's Heathrow Airport closes for the day after power failure

description: Gazans are struggling to find enough food and water to survive as conditions continue to remain dire in the Gaza strip. This comes after the ceasefire between Hamas and Israel has ended. NBC News' Matt Bradley reports.
title: Gazans search for food and water after end of ceasefire

description: A Georgetown University graduate student from India who was taken into custody this week and targeted for deportation by the Trump administration never made any pro-Hamas or antisemitic comments, his lawyer said.
title: Detained Georgetown University grad student never made pro-Hamas statements, attorney says

description: LAS VEGAS — At the first stop of their “Fighting Oligarchy” tour out West, two of the Democratic Party’s most unabashed progressive lawmakers had plenty to say about President Donald Trump.
title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Bernie Sanders rally Democrats, calling for a party that 'fights harder'

description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., and Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., brought their "Fighting Oligarchy" Tour to Las Vegas, N.V., where they spoke about the lack of current Democratic leadership and criticism over Elon Musk's spending cuts.
title: Sanders, Ocasio-Cortez hold 'Fight the Oligarchy' rally in Las Vegas
